qas.question: a antenna element not connected to anything is circuited how?
When is the element not allowed voltage?
What element absorbs and reradiate RF-energy?
What antenna can the solid rod be viewed as a dipole antenna?
Where can this solid rod be viewed?

context: This is a consequence of Lorentz reciprocity. For an antenna element  not connected to anything (<a0_0>open circuited<a0_0/>) one can write . But for an element  which is <a1_0>short circuited<a1_0/>, a current is generated across that short but no voltage is allowed, so the corresponding . This is the case, for instance, with the so-called parasitic elements of a <a3_0>Yagi-Uda<a3_0/> antenna where the solid rod can be viewed as a dipole antenna shorted across its <a4_0>feedpoint<a4_0/>. <a2_0>Parasitic<a2_0/> elements are unpowered elements that absorb and reradiate RF energy according to the induced current calculated using such a system of equations.
